Shingo Obata PhD in Forestry and Natural Resources/Forest Management/Forest Inventory/Spatial Analysis/Remote Sensing/Machine Learning

About

Shingo Obata

(小幡進午)

Postdoctoral Research Associate

Google Scholar
Research Gate
Tweets by ShingObt

I am a postdoctoral research associate at the National Institute for Mathematical and Biological Synthesis. My research interests are forest management and remote sensing. My main focus is national-scale forest inventory analysis in the U.S. South and Japan using remote sensing data and field inventory data. In my research I intensively use R, Python and Google Earth Engine. In my free time I enjoy hiking, cooking and running.

Education

  • 2016 - 2020: Ph. D. in Forestry and Natural Resources, the University of Georgia, Georgia, USA
  • 2014 - 2016: MSc in Forest Science, the University of Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan
  • 2010 - 2014: BA in Agriculture, the University of Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan

    • Experience

  • Apr 2022-: Project Assistant Professor, The Institute of Statistical Mathematics, Tokyo, Japan
  • Oct 2020 - Mar 2022: Postdoctoral Research Associate, the National Institute for Mathematical and Biological Synthesis, Tennessee, USA
  • Fall 2016 - Fall 2019: Teaching assistant, University of Georgia, Georgia, USA

    • Grant

  • 2016-2019: Student Exchange Support Program from Japan Student Services Organization ($31,654 for each year)

    Portfolio

    Store opening and closure in japan

    This project analyzes and visualizes the store opening and closure trend in Japan using Flask and PostGIS.
    July 2021

    Air polution under pandemic

    This project compares the airpolution before and afte the pandemic in 2020.
    January 2021

    Forest resources in georgia

    Dynamic features of the forest resources in the state of Georgia is visualized in this project.
    June 2020

    Franchise location

    A dashboard that shows the location and store information of Yoshinoya and Starbucks in Japan.
    October 2019

    Height estimation with uas data

    Tree height estimation using drone imagery.
    January 2019

    Works

    My works published/presented since 2017.

    Refereed Articles

  • Obata, S., Cieszewski, C. J., Lowe, R. C., & Bettinger, P. (2021). Random Forest Regression Model for Estimation of the Growing Stock Volumes in Georgia, USA, Using Dense Landsat Time Series and FIA Dataset. Remote Sensing, 13(2), 218. => Article link
  • Obata, S., Bettinger, P., Cieszewski, C. J., & Lowe III, R. C. (2020). Mapping Forest Disturbances between 1987-2016 Using All Available Time Series Landsat TM/ETM+ Imagery: Developing a Reliable Methodology for Georgia, United States. Forests, 11(3), 335. => Article link
  • Zhang, S., Bettinger, P., Cieszewski, C., Merkle, S., Merry, K., Obata, S., He, X., & Zheng, H. (2019). Evaluation of sites for the reestablishment of the American chestnut (Castanea dentata) in northeast Georgia, USA. Landscape Ecology, 34(4), 943–960. => Article link
  • Obata, S., Cieszewski, C. J., Bettinger, P., Lowe III, R. C., & Bernardes, S. (2019). Preliminary analysis of forest stand disturbances in Coastal Georgia (USA) using Landsat time series stacked imagery. FORMATH, 18, 1–11. => Article link
  • Obata, S. (2018). Estimation of forest stand disturbance through implementation of vegetation change tracker algorithm using Landsat time series stacked imagery in coastal Georgia. Mathematical and Computational Forestry and Natural-Resource Sciences, 10(1), 32.
  • Akbulut, R., Bettinger, P., Ucar, Z., Obata, S., Boston, K., & Siry, J. (2017). Spatial Forest Plan Development Using Heuristic Processes Seeded with a Relaxed Linear Programming Solution. Forest Science, 63(5), 518–528. => Article link
  • Akbulut, R., Ucar, Z., Bettinger, P., Merry, K., & Obata, S. (2017). Effects of forest thinning on static horizontal position accuracy collected with a mapping-grade GNSS receiver. Mathematical and Computational Forestry & Natural-Resource Sciences, 9(1), 14–21. => Article link

Spatiotemporal analysis of Landsat imagery for assessment of disturbance tracking in coastal Georgia [Oral Presentation].
